channel.title: NPR Topics: World
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu discussed peace deal, Iran and more in meeting
item.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu in Florida as the men discuss peace plans in the Middle East.
item.content:encoded: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu in Florida as the men discuss peace plans in the Middle East.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordo√±ez

item.title: The U.S. offers Ukraine a 15-year security guarantee for now, Zelenskyy says
item.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.
item.content:encoded:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the United States is offering his country security guarantees for 15 years as part of a proposed peace plan.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump says Ukraine peace is closer. And, how funding cuts affect anti-poverty groups
item.description: Trump and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy signaled momentum on peace talks after a meeting yesterday. And, anti-poverty groups address challenges they are facing that impact Americans who need help.
item.content:encoded:
Trump and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy signaled momentum on peace talks after a meeting yesterday. And, anti-poverty groups address challenges they are facing that impact Americans who need help.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Ex-Pentagon official on the prospects of a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
item.description: Ukraine's president visited Mar-a-Lago Sunday. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former Pentagon official Evelyn Farkas, now executive director of the McCain Institute, about prospects for peace.
item.content:encoded: Ukraine's president visited Mar-a-Lago Sunday. NPR's Leila Fadel talks to former Pentagon official Evelyn Farkas, now executive director of the McCain Institute, about prospects for peace.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Trump says there's progress on a peace deal between Ukraine and Russia
item.description: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they are making progress on a peace deal to end the war in Russia after meeting in Mar-a-Lago Sunday.
item.content:encoded: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy say they are making progress on a peace deal to end the war in Russia after meeting in Mar-a-Lago Sunday.
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump says progress is being made on a deal between Ukraine and Russia, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump Monday, anti-poverty groups are bracing for what lies ahead after a year of chaos.
item.content:encoded: Trump says progress is being made on a deal between Ukraine and Russia, Israeli prime minister to meet with Trump Monday, anti-poverty groups are bracing for what lies ahead after a year of chaos.
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to meet with President Trump in Florida
item.description: The Israeli Prime Minister will meet President Trump in Florida Monday, with talks expected to focus on the next phases of the peace plan for Gaza.
item.content:encoded: The Israeli Prime Minister will meet President Trump in Florida Monday, with talks expected to focus on the next phases of the peace plan for Gaza.
item.dc:creator: Michele Kelemen

item.title: How President Trump has reshaped U.S.-Israel relations
item.description: With Israel's prime minister at the White House Monday, former peace negotiator Aaron David Miller speaks with NPR's Leila Fadel about the ways President Trump has reshaped U.S.-Israel relations.
item.content:encoded: With Israel's prime minister at the White House Monday, former peace negotiator Aaron David Miller speaks with NPR's Leila Fadel about the ways President Trump has reshaped U.S.-Israel relations.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Chinese military stages drills around Taiwan to warn 'external forces'
item.description: The drills came after Beijing expressed anger at U.S. arms sales, and a statement by Japan's prime minister saying its military could get involved if China were to take action against Taiwan.
item.content:encoded:
The drills came after Beijing expressed anger at U.S. arms sales, and a statement by Japan's prime minister saying its military could get involved if China were to take action against Taiwan.

(Image credit: Li Gang/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump and Netanyahu to meet in Florida at a crucial moment for the Gaza ceasefire
item.description: President Trump could use the face-to-face at his Mar-a-Lago estate to look for ways to speed up the peace process, as Israel's leader has been accused of not pushing his side to move fast enough.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump could use the face-to-face at his Mar-a-Lago estate to look for ways to speed up the peace process, as Israel's leader has been accused of not pushing his side to move fast enough.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
